overview: 1 Samuel records Israel's transition from judges to monarchy, featuring Samuel the prophet, Saul the failed king, and David's rise. It explores themes of leadership, obedience, and God's sovereignty.

verses.text: But the LORD said to Samuel, 'Do not look on his appearance or on the height of his stature, because I have rejected him. For the LORD sees not as man sees: man looks on the outward appearance, but the LORD looks on the heart.'
And Samuel said, 'Has the LORD as great delight in burnt offerings and sacrifices, as in obeying the voice of the LORD? Behold, to obey is better than sacrifice, and to listen than the fat of rams.'
And that all this assembly may know that the LORD saves not with sword and spear. For the battle is the LORD's, and he will give you into our hand.

passages.title: Hannah's Prayer
passages.summary: A barren woman prays desperately for a child and dedicates him to God. Her son Samuel becomes Israel's last judge and kingmaker.

passages.title: David and Goliath
passages.summary: A young shepherd defeats a giant warrior with a sling and stone, demonstrating that faith in God overcomes any obstacle.

passages.title: Saul's Rejection
passages.summary: King Saul's partial obedience to God's command leads to his rejection as king, teaching that obedience matters more than religious ritual.

facts.text: Samuel was the last judge and first of the prophets in the formal sense, bridging two eras of Israel's history.
David was anointed king years before he actually took the throne, spending much of that time fleeing from jealous King Saul.
Goliath was about 9 feet 9 inches tall (six cubits and a span), and his armor weighed about 125 pounds.
The friendship between David and Jonathan is one of the Bible's greatest examples of loyal friendship, despite Jonathan being heir to the throne David would take.

figures.name: Samuel
figures.description: Prophet, priest, and judge who anointed both Saul and David as kings. Born in answer to his mother Hannah's desperate prayer.

figures.name: Saul
figures.description: Israel's first king, chosen for his impressive appearance. His disobedience and jealousy led to his rejection by God and tragic end.

figures.name: David
figures.description: The shepherd boy anointed to be king. A man after God's own heart who faced Goliath with faith and would become Israel's greatest king.

figures.name: Jonathan
figures.description: Saul's son and David's closest friend. He selflessly supported David's kingship over his own claim to the throne.

videos.title: 1 Samuel Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores Israel's transition to monarchy and the rise of David.
